fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-62859].
  {panel}

When you attempt to search for issues in JIRA with special characters ( - ) some issues are returned, however, not all issues are returned.

How to Replicate:

Create 5 issues:

test-test
test-1test
test-1test-1
test-25-test-2
test-322-test-4

Search for Search for summary ~ "test"

The results come back and the only issue that is found is test-test

The first issue is returned but the rest are not.

Attempting to escape the characters with \ or \\ per [Search syntax for text fields|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRACORESERVER071/Search+syntax+for+text+fields#PerformingTextSearches-EscapingSpecialCharactersor] does not work.

A search for summary ~ "test*" returns the issues but also returns more results than the intended data set.
fields.summary: Escaping special characters in JQL search doesn't work

h3. Problem Definition
Currently, there is no report available to show the number of completed story points split between stories and bugs for example. Customers would want to calculate the split between capital investments (stories) and maintenance costs (bugs).

h3. Suggested Solution
Add a report which will show completed Story Points based on issue types
fields.summary: Create a report based on issue type

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
When a dateformat is configured in JIRA for the datepicker field, JIRA fails to abide by this date ruling for datepicker fields found in report pages.

h3. Environment
* Jira 7.2
* Using [Timesheet Reports and Gadgets|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/apps/294/timesheet-reports-and-gadgets?hosting=cloud&tab=overview].

h3. Steps To Reproduce
# Go to {{Admin > System > General Configuration}} page.
# Click on Advanced Settings
# Modify the Java date picker to the format {{dd.mm.YYYY}}
# Modify the JavaScript date picker to the format {{%d.%m.%Y}}
# Go to {{Look & Feel}} page.
# Modify the date picker to: {{dd/MM/yy}}
# Install the plugin Timesheet Report and Gadget for JIRA.
# Go any {{project > Report > Timesheet Report}} page.
# Attempt to use the date picker fields.

 !screenshot-1.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Expected Result
* JIRA would show the correct date format where 1/10/2016 = 1st October 2016.

h3. Actual Result
* JIRA would show the incorrect date format where 1/10/2016 = 10th January 2016.

h3. Note
The issue disappears once the day goes past a corresponding month.

h3. Workaround
* This has been fixed on the add-on side. Upgrading to version 3.2 of Timesheet Reports and Gadgets or newer will fix the behavior reported here.
fields.summary: Broken DateFormat in Reports DatePicker fields.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-62856].
  {panel}

Hi,

Something that is always a problem for my company is keeping project components in sync across multiple similar projects.

Is there any possibility of adding in future support to natively synchronise components between selected projects ?

I had previously looked for plugins but there doesn't seem to be any reliable / compatible ones available for JIRA 7+

Many Thanks,

Mark Woolley
Gradwell Communications Ltd.
fields.summary: Cross-Project Component Syncing

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When creating a subtask for a Story under an Epic issue using the gear icon on the Epic view, creates the subtask under the Epic rather than the Story.




h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create an Epic
# Create a Story under that Epic
# On Epic issue click on the gear box next to the Story issue and try to create a subtask for the Story

h3. Expected Results
Subtask is created under Story

h3. Actual Results
Subtask is created under Epic issue
 


h3.Workaround
Create the Subtask from the view screen of the Story rather than the Epic.
fields.summary: Creating a subtask for a Story under Epic, creates a subtask for the Epic itself

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-62852].
  {panel}

The JQL search for issues with attachments does not respect the Hidden status of the attachments.

Steps to Reproduce:
* Add an attachment to an issue
* Mark the attachment field as "hidden" in the field config scheme
* Search "project = FOO and attachment is not empty"

Expected Result:
Issue does not show up in the search result

Actual Result:
The issue appears in the search result

Workaround:
No Workaround.
fields.summary: Attachments in JQL do not respect field visibility

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-62851].
  {panel}

Currently, JIRA's default setting for jira.search.maxclauses is 65000. If JIRA has more than this amount in *Unrelased Versions*, boards will break with this error in the logs:
{code}
2014-03-16 20:03:11,778 http-bio-8080-exec-4 ERROR admin 1263x121x1 1b1c4rs 1.1.1.1.1 /rest/greenhopper/1.0/xboard/work/allData.json [greenhopper.service.issue.IssueDataServiceImpl] A the following query was too complex to generate a query from: {fixVersion in unreleasedVersions()}
com.atlassian.jira.issue.search.ClauseTooComplexSearchException: A the following query was too complex to generate a query from: {fixVersion in unreleasedVersions()}
        at com.atlassian.jira.jql.query.DefaultLuceneQueryBuilder.createLuceneQuery(DefaultLuceneQueryBuilder.java:43)
        at com.atlassian.jira.issue.search.providers.LuceneSearchProvider.search(LuceneSearchProvider.java:309)
        at com.atlassian.jira.issue.search.providers.LuceneSearchProvider.search(LuceneSearchProvider.java:153)
        at sun.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke0(Native Method)
        at sun.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(NativeMethodAccessorImpl.java:57)
        at sun.reflect.DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.java:43)
        at java.lang.reflect.Method.invoke(Method.java:606)
        at com.atlassian.plugin.osgi.hostcomponents.impl.DefaultComponentRegistrar$ContextClassLoaderSettingInvocationHandler.invoke(DefaultComponentRegistrar.java:129)
        at com.sun.proxy.$Proxy228.search(Unknown Source)
        at sun.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke0(Native Method)
        at sun.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(NativeMethodAccessorImpl.java:57)
        at sun.reflect.DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.java:43)
        at java.lang.reflect.Method.invoke(Method.java:606)
        at com.atlassian.plugin.osgi.bridge.external.HostComponentFactoryBean$DynamicServiceInvocationHandler.invoke(HostComponentFactoryBean.java:154)
        at com.sun.proxy.$Proxy228.search(Unknown Source)
        at com.atlassian.greenhopper.service.issue.IssueDataServiceImpl.findImpl(IssueDataServiceImpl.java:166)
        at com.atlassian.greenhopper.service.issue.IssueDataServiceImpl.findWithServiceOutcome(IssueDataServiceImpl.java:48)
        at com.atlassian.greenhopper.web.rapid.work.WorkDataFactory.getWorkDataIssueCountAndLastUpdated(WorkDataFactory.java:234)
        at com.atlassian.greenhopper.web.rapid.work.WorkDataFactory.getAllData(WorkDataFactory.java:141)
        at com.atlassian.greenhopper.web.rapid.work.WorkResource$1.call(WorkResource.java:70)
        at com.atlassian.greenhopper.web.rapid.work.WorkResource$1.call(WorkResource.java:59)
        at com.atlassian.greenhopper.web.util.RestCall.response(RestCall.java:48)
        at com.atlassian.greenhopper.web.AbstractResource.response(AbstractResource.java:60)
        at com.atlassian.greenhopper.web.rapid.work.WorkResource.getPoolData(WorkResource.java:58)
        at sun.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke0(Native Method)
...
{code}

h4. Workaround
* Release/archive versions until the system is under the 65000 limit
or
* Increase the default limit of 65000, but it is not known how this will affect future performance of the system.
{code}
jira.search.maxclauses = 65000
{code}
fields.summary: Having a huge set of versions causes Boards to break

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-62850].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition

Currently When moving JIRA and Confluence to a different environment, most of the time in order to test. The new environment has different URLs, which affects the issue link in JIRA and page links in Confluence as they rely on application link which has been defined earlier on the older environment.

h3. Suggested Resolution

Confluence links in JIRA need to be updated as the new applink is created.

h3. Temporary Resolution

This issue can be solved by taking the steps at [Application Link Issue When Moving JIRA and Confluence|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirakb/application-link-issue-when-moving-jira-and-confluence-to-different-environment-856843626.html] for now.
fields.summary: Update Confluence Links In JIRA Automatically Base On The New Applink Configurations

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-62845].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition

When accessing the *Issues* shortcut on a project, the user will always be directed to the *Open Issues* filter. It is not currently possible to set a different filter as the default one for this access.

h3. Suggested Solution

Allow users to choose a default filter when accessing the *Issues* page through a project.

h3. Why this is important
 
Allowing users to choose a default filter would facilitate things, such as leaving the most used filter as the default one - it would prevent the user from having to change the filter every time the *Issues* page is accessed.
fields.summary: Allow users to set custom/system filters as default on issue navigator

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
*NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-62844].
{panel}
h3. Summary

Currently, to use OAuth for REST API authentication, an application link must be created. This will be tedious especially if there are many developers (e.g. 100+) who want to use OAuth.
h3. Suggestion

Make it easier to generate an OAuth access token. For example, each user should be able to create a private access token from their user profile.
fields.summary: Easier method to generate token for REST API OAuth authentication

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Using REST api perform the transition for closing an issue [https://docs.atlassian.com/jira/REST/cloud/#api/2/issue-doTransition|https://docs.atlassian.com/jira/REST/cloud/#api/2/issue-doTransition].

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
A version of Log4j 1.2.17 which has been shipping with JIRA is not supported anymore. 

h3. Suggested Solution
Upgrade to a supported version of Log4j 2.x. See http://logging.apache.org/log4j/2.x/ 

h3. Workaround 
None

h3. Note on CVE-2021-44228
Short summary: *not vulnerable* to CVE-2021-44228 

Details: 
quote from [FAQ for CVE-2021-44228|https://confluence.atlassian.com/kb/faq-for-cve-2021-44228-1103069406.html]
{quote}
...
Some on-premises products use an Atlassian-maintained fork of Log4j 1.2.17, which is *not vulnerable to CVE-2021-44228*. 
We have done additional analysis on this fork and confirmed a new but similar vulnerability that can only be exploited by a trusted party. For that reason, Atlassian rates the *severity level* for on-premises products as *low*.
{quote}

h3. Note on CVE-2019-17571
Short summary: *not vulnerable* to CVE-2019-17571

Details:
Vulnerability details: [CVE-2019-17571|https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2019-17571] and [Deserialization of Untrusted Data|https://security.snyk.io/vuln/SNYK-JAVA-LOG4J-572732]
bq. SocketServer class that is vulnerable to deserialization of untrusted data which can be exploited to remotely execute arbitrary code when combined with a deserialization gadget when listening to untrusted network traffic for log data.

* The vulnerability can only be exploited if log4j is configured to receive log messages from other systems over TCP or UDP, this is not a default setting (i). 
* Also, Jira uses Atlassian-maintained fork of Log4j (1.2.17-atlassian-3). In that version, we deleted the code affected by CVE-2019-17571, so it's no longer even possible to configure it to make the vulnerability exploitable (/).
fields.summary: Upgrade to log4j 2.x

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-62837].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
Currently there are no extra messages to debug the synchronization of a Crowd User Directory in JIRA.
Enabling com.atlassian.crowd.directory does increase the logging level when we have a Connector or Delegated directory, but using a Crowd directory does not log any extra messages.

h3. Suggested Solution
Set the same debug log messages logged for Connector/Delegated directories for Crowd/JIRA directories.
fields.summary: Increase JIRA synchronization with Crowd debug logs

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-62836].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition

When you run a JQL search and then use the feature "Share this search result"
 !Screen Shot 2016-10-13 at 12.24.20.png|thumbnail! 
 the notification email will only display a link for the user to view the search results. 
 !Screen Shot 2016-10-13 at 12.23.01.png|thumbnail!
h3. Suggested Solution
 # To have a list of all tickets like JIRA does on filter subscription
 !Screen Shot 2016-10-13 at 12.26.01.png|thumbnail! 
 OR
 # Email a pdf with links to the tickets (still showing up all the tickets instead of just a link with the search results)

h3. Workaround

It's possible to create a JQL Query and save the filter. After, just ask for people to subscribe to that filter. This will only work for JIRA users.
fields.summary: Share this search feature should have the issues' list on notification email

fields.description:
h3. Summary

When an issue with long description and sub task is viewed in JIRA 719, it automatically gets scrolled down to sub-tasks.
Ideally, it should be at the top of the page.

h3. Environment
* JIRA 7.1.9

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create Issue.
# Have long description for this issue so that we need to scroll down.
# Create Sub-task for this issue.
# Now try to view issue again in new tab.

h3. Expected Results
It should be at the top of the page.

h3. Actual Results
It automatically gets scrolled down to subtask.
 
h3. Notes
The same behaviour is not occurring in JIRA version 6.4.14 as well as latest JIRA version 7.2.x
fields.summary: Inconsistent Behavior In View Issue Page For Issue With Long Description and Subtask

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-62831].
  {panel}

h3. Summary

When importing issues with CSV, JIRA should show a warning message before the import if the CSV contains issues whose all field values are empty.

h3. Environment

* JIRA 7.2.2

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a project named "test" (whose project key is "TEST")
# Go to *Administration > System > Import and Export > External System Import > CSV*
# Import  [^test.csv] 
#- Select *Defined in CSV* as "Import to Project" option

h3. Expected Results
It would be nice if JIRA shows warning message *BEFORE* importing the CSV which contains issues whose all field values are empty.

h3. Actual Results
*AFTER* importing the CSV, JIRA showed "CSV row cannot be associated with any project" as follows.
 !csv-import.png|thumbnail!

h3. Notes
The background of this feature request is that one of our customers said it would be nice if they could notice if there is something wrong with the CSV data *BEFORE* importing it.
fields.summary: When importing issues with CSV, JIRA should show a warning message before the import if the CSV contains issues whose all field values are empty

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}

  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition

JIRA Data Center currently uses random ports to access other nodes, which can cause problems if there are security restrictions in place.

h3. Suggested Solution

Provide an ability to configure the outbound port that is used.

fields.description:
Steps to reproduce:
 # unpack standalone JIRA
 # go to bin directory
 # run config.sh -c
 # configure jira home and save settings
 # observe that created dbconfig.xml dose not contain correct jira home in jdbc connection configuration for H2 database - JIRA will not start correctly

Workaround:
Run config.sh -c once agains. Configure H2 database and save and exit.

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Focus on the selected comment is set on {{DOMContentLoaded}}.

However, panels in the view issue page might fetch content asynchronously and mutate the DOM (fusion panels, atlassian-connect rendered panels ...) and then push down the content.

As a consequence focus will be lost from the selected comment.
h3. Steps
 * Click on the permalink to a comment for an issue with a merged pull request.

h3.  Actual behaviour
 * Notice that focus is initially set correctly, however once the dev panel fetches the merge status it will push down the page content and focus will be lost from the comment.

h3. Notes

The incorrect behaviour is more noticeable when the sidebar is turned off in the view issue page.
fields.summary: Focus on the currently selected comment in the view issue page is lost after content is asynchronously loaded in a panel

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-62823].
  {panel}

h3. Summary

The [_cascadingselect_ field type|https://developer.atlassian.com/jiradev/jira-platform/building-jira-add-ons/jira-plugins2-overview/configuring-plugins-with-object-configurable-parameters] does not work in the [reports plugin module|https://developer.atlassian.com/jiradev/jira-platform/building-jira-add-ons/jira-plugins2-overview/jira-plugin-module-types/report-plugin-module]. A plugin attempting to use this field type will compile without problems, but no select input field will be rendered in the final report.
h3. Environment
 - JIRA 7.2.3;
 - OSX 10.11.2;
 - Chrome 53.0.2785.143.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a plugin that utilises the [report plugin module|https://developer.atlassian.com/jiradev/jira-platform/building-jira-add-ons/jira-plugins2-overview/jira-plugin-module-types/report-plugin-module].
 # Define a new report in the {{atlassian-plugin.xml}}, and specify a _cascadingselect_ field type (example below):
{noformat}
...
<property>
  <key>selectForCascade</key>
  <name>Select for cascade</name>
  <description>First part of the cascading field</description>
  <type>select</type>
  <values>
    <value>
      <key>happy</key>
      <value>Happy</value>
    </value>
    <value>
      <key>sad</key>
      <value>Sad</value>
    </value>
  </values>
</property>
<property>
  <key>aCascade</key>
  <name>Cascade select field</name>
  <description>Secondt part of the cascading field</description>
  <type>cascadingselect</type>
  <cascade-from>selectForCascade</cascade-from>
  <values>
    <value>
      <key>cat</key>
      <value>Cat</value>
    </value>
    <value>
      <key>dog</key>
      <value>Dog</value>
    </value>
  </values>
</property>
...




{noformat}

 # Navigate to the custom report.

h3. Expected Results

Two select fields should be present on the configure report screen (hardcoded values in the second select should come from a {{ValuesGenerator}} that depends on the value of the first select).
h3. Actual Results

No input field is rendered at all for the second select, and if a {{ValuesGenerator}} was used to populate the second select, it is never executed.  
h3. Workaround

According to [this Confluence Question|https://answers.atlassian.com/questions/128375/options-for-reports-using-cascading-select], the [eazyBI Reports Plugin|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/plugins/com.eazybi.jira.plugins.eazybi-jira/server/overview] can provide this functionality.
fields.summary: CascadingSelect field type is broken in core reports

h3. Summary

 
h3. Environment

JIRA Software + some active sprint
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Go to some active sprint
 ## Start pressing tab, you will go over the items from menu eg. active sprints->releases->reports->issues->components->test sessions... add link 
!image-2016-10-17-08-03-26-382.png!
When you are on the last link and press tab the focus will be transfered to the "board" button  !image-2016-10-17-08-04-18-420.png!  and you can not focus on the "Complete Sprint" link using the tab (keyboard"

h3. Expected Results

User can focus the "Complete Sprint" link using keyboard navigation (tab)
h3. Actual Results

"Complete Sprint" link is skipped when navigating using keyboard (tab).
h3.  
h3. Workaround

Use mouse to click the link

Internet explorer 11

Use more modern browser eg. chrome

fields.description:
When hover over fields to edit them in the Issue Navigator's DetailsView, labels are not aligned correctly in their edit box. The labels appear correctly when they are added, but not when you go to edit them.

The labels appear correctly in Chrome, but not Safari (and potentially other browsers too).
fields.summary: Labels in DetailsView are aligned incorrectly onhover in Safari
Cluster cache problem: java.lang.ClassNotFoundException: com.atlassian.jira.plugins.importer.web.ImporterLogsPage$EmptyTaskContext

fields.description:
Burndown chart is missing issues when issue is transitioned in the same second that issue was created.

Steps to reproduce:
1. create issue and immediately transition it to other status (eg. by using rest API) so that transition happens in the same second that the issue was created in
2. use issue in the sprint
3. close sprint
4. go to burndown chart - the issue is not in the "start sprint" row

Expected behaviour
Issue is included in the "start sprint" row
fields.summary: burndown chart is missing issues in start spring row
burndown chart issues in "sprint start" row have to have column change

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-62797].
  {panel}

Steps to reproduce:
1. Create a sprint and place an issue in it.
2. Start the sprint.
3. Complete the sprint.
4. Reopen the sprint.
5. Check the burndown chart for the sprint. The chart table will not show the Sprint ended and Sprint reopened events.
6. Go to the active sprint and transition the issue to Done.
7. Check the burndown chart now, It will look a bit like the screenshot; the Sprint ended and reopened events will be visible before the transitioned event.

Expected: The Sprint ended and reopened events should be shown regardless of whether an issue burndown event occured after them.
fields.summary: Sprint ended + Sprint reopened events only appear in burndown chart log after an issue event takes place.
hipchat panel does not refresh after description edit

fields.description:
h3. Steps to reproduce

Navigate between the backlog to the Active Sprint tabs

Observe the ajax calls being made

 
h3. Actual Result

When moving from the Backlog tab to the Active Sprint tab, 3 ajax calls are made to
http://<server>/jira/rest/projects/1.0/project/<projectId>/lastVisited

 
h3. Expected result

We execute 1 ajax call maximum for the given resource
h3. Notes

Believe its due to the 'before:navigate:prevented' event being fired multiple times.
fields.summary: Going between Backlog and Active Sprint fires 3 lastVisited rest calls

fields.description:
h3. Steps to reproduce

Dismiss the Healthcheck notification.
Check the javascript console
h3. Actual results

415 unsupported media type error is shown after rest request completes.

 
h3. Expected results

No error code is returned and no error is shown in the console.
fields.summary: Dismissing the HealthCheck dialog throws a javascript error
Reindexing issues with JIRA lock is slower than in background

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-62792].
  {panel}

Steps to reproduce:
# Open RTE (e.g. press Comment button)
# Type one character
# Undo button is still disabled, hotkey doesn't remove the character either
# Type some text - everything is undoable now
# Switch mode
# Apply some style to the typed text
# Undo button is still disabled, hotkey doesn't remove styling
# Apply some other style or type smth - everything is undoable now
fields.summary: WYSIWYG - Could not undo the first action made after switching mode

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-62791].
  {panel}

Comes up quite small - 
h3. Steps to reproduce

Close the agile view window (on the right).

Select issue

Click 'm' to trigger the comment dialog.

 
h3. Result

Dialog is displayed, comment block looks shrunk

 
h3. Expected Result

Big comment blog (as with Flag issue) dialog, see attachment: expected-flag-and-comment.png

 
h3. Notes

see the attached JSEV-781 for the original images.

 
h3.
fields.summary: Size of comment window on agile board is shrunk

fields.description: JIRA time-outs when trying to login using data center. To reproduce simply: setup JIRA, generate large number of users (~500k), shutdown JIRA, start one node, do not log in yet, start second node, wait for all nodes to finish startup, try logging in on one of the nodes.
fields.summary: Time out on login with datacenter and large number of users

fields.description:
h4. Steps
# Copy an image into your clipboard
# Go to [issue nav|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRA-62789?jql=]
# Start adding a comment
# Paste the image
# Close the attach screenshot dialog with ESC
# Select another issue
# Start adding a comment
# Paste the image

h4. Expectation
The attach screenshot dialog pops up

h4. Reality
 !image-2016-08-10-14-35-08-008.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Image pasting causes errors

{code}
 
h3. Expected result

Instead of a server error, we do show a page showing user management is not possible.

 
h3. Notes

Tried to change the email of jirasrv-wb-bot to [dmoore@atlassian.com|mailto:dmoore@atlassian.com] on bulldog. Got the attached error.

I believe perhaps this error is warranted, but the format of the message is ugly. If it's a warranted message, then let's update to a better looking one that clarifies what the issue is.

 
h3. Workaround

The directory is read only in Crowd, and the Crowd directory in JIRA is read/write. The JIRA configuration has to be set for read-only for the case manages user from the read-only directory.
fields.summary: Exception when changing an email for the user when external directory (crowd) is used
DevStatusPermissionService disappeared from OSGi

fields.description:
Summary

Empty page is shown in the global issue navigator.

 
h3. Steps to reproduce

Create a number of filters, that don't fit into one page and scroller shows.

Perform a search in issue navigator that results in zero issues

Attempt to scroll the toolbar on the left.

 
h3. Actual result

The page layout get broken, scrollable area got split by the footer.

 
h3. Expected Result

Page navigation and scrolling is working without any artifacts.

 
h3. Notes

This only happens in the Global Issue Navigator on empty state. Sidebar has to be collapsed and then hovered so it is in "fly out" state. See attached video.
fields.summary: Z-Index problem on Global Issue Navigator sidebar and empty state

fields.description:
h3. Issue summary
Strange license error message when importing backup

h3. Steps to reproduce
I want to import the Cloud backup into Server instance. Once I hit "restore" button I get the message about "Cloud new version" and that not everything may work etc. I click that I am ok with that and expect to go further with the import.

h3. Expected Result
You can restore the data from Cloud into server without specifying any license.
 
h3. Actual Results
"You have not entered a license."
just under this there is an information:
"Only enter a license if you want to override all the licenses in the import file."
If I do not enter the license I cannot proceed.

h3. Workaround
Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Strange license error message when importing backup

fields.description:
Summary

Permission check reports that anonymous user can browse project, but in fact these users can not access the project.

 
h3. Steps to reproduce
 # Create a project with the default settings.
 # Navigate to project (cog) -> administration -> permissions
 # Ensure anonymous users do not have the browse permission.
 # Run permission helper & ensure it reports user can access
 # Log-out from JIRA
 # Navigate to the project since the user is logged out

h3. Actual Result

Anonymous users can not browse the project (step 6).

Permission helper reports anonymous users can access the project.

 
h3. Expected Result

Permission helper must report that anonymous users do not have the browse permissions, when anonymous users are not granted such permissions.
fields.summary: Anonymous users can not browse the project while the permission helper check reports they should be able to

fields.description:
h3. Summary

WADL document is not accessable, because of server error during it's generation (happens because of not satisfied dependancies for Atlassian REST Module)
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Have a running JIRA 7.1.x instance
 # Log in as administrator
 # Go to: <jira>/rest/api/2/application.wadl ([for JAC|https://jira.atlassian.com/rest/api/2/application.wadl])

h3. Expected Results

Page shows WADL document
h3. Actual Results

Page shows code 500
h3. Workaround

Update to JIRA 7.2.0+
fields.summary: WADL generation is broken in JIRA 7.1

fields.description:
h3. Steps to reproduce

1) Start adding a new label (there should be more than a few already added)

2) While doing this, before saving,  zoom in the browesr's window.

 
h3. Actual result

Labels are broken (see the screenshot)

 
h3. Expected result

Labels are properly zoomed in
fields.summary: Labels input breaks when zoomed in while edited

Hi,

Our users would like to search on issues he has added comments to.  It would be a handy way to choose issues to be watched.

We can currently search on text within comments, but not filter on comment-authors.

In the filter page, perhaps as one of the attribute fields, there could be a field for "Includes Comment By".

Thanks,
Steve

Stephen Butler, Software Logistics Dept.

Tel +49 711 1398 1357, Fax +49 711 866 1240

{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-62775].
  {panel}

h3. Summary

Can't input Japanese characters correctly in Summary field on iOS app.

h3. Environment

* iOS app : v12.0.0.34
* JIRA Cloud : v1000.383.3

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Try to create (or edit) a issue
# Input Japanese characters in *Summary* field on the issue
#* e.g.) Input Japanese characters in the order of "あ", "い", "う", "え", "お"
# Input the same Japanese characters in *Description* field on the issue

h3. Expected Results

We should be able to input the Japanese characters correctly in Summary field as is in Description field.
(When it comes to the above example, the characters in Summary field should be shown as "あいうえお".)

h3. Actual Results

The characters in Summary field was shown as "ああいあいうあいうえあいうえお" even though the characters in Description field was shown correctly. Please see the following screenshot.

 !jira-mobile.png|thumbnail! 


h3.Workaround

There is no workaround at this moment.
fields.summary: Can't input Japanese characters correctly in Summary field on iOS app

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-62774].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
Currently in JIRA project the *Summary* page is in "Activity" view each time when user opens that page. There is a “Switch view” menu for changing to the "Statistics" view.
However there is no option to set the "Statistics" view as the default view for *Summary* page.

h3. Suggested Solution
Add an option to set the default view for *Summary* page.
fields.summary: Allow setting default view for project summary page

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-62773].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Solution.
When we try to authentication JIRA to another application for example from the Activity Stream, it will create another tab for the authentication process. Apparently, if we did not follow the authentication process from the new tab that is created from it and just used the tab for browsing another website when we tried to do the authentication again, it will reuse the same tab for the same process. This can lead the user to confusion as the previous page are suddenly changed or on some cases, it will stay on the same page while the page loads in another tab.

h3. Suggested Solution.
To create a new tab and redirect users to the tab when a user tries to authenticate to other application, rather than reusing any previous tabs that are originally for authentication as well.
fields.summary: Application Link Authentication to always create another Tab/Window and redirect user to it

h3. Summary

Any simultaneous calls to {{<T> T getComponent(final Class<T> componentType)}} and to {{<T> List<T> getComponents(final Class<T> componentType)}} in {{DefaultPicoContainer}} from parallel threads can lead to deadlock.

(i) A more specific version of the problem covering scenario when _localhost-startStop-1_ and {{localq-reader}} threads are deadlocking during DC node startup, see JRASERVER-70816.

When {{DefaultPicoContainer}} has {{<T> List<T> getComponents(final Class<T> componentType)}} invoked it enters into synchronised block over itself and proceeds further and eventually ends up in {{Locked#getComponentInstance}} where it tries to acquire {{ReetrantLock.}} Unfortunately, this lock is already acquired by another thread which invoked {{<T> T getComponent(final Class<T> componentType)}} and this second threads proceeds further and perform back-call to {{DefaultPicoContainer#getConverters}} which is "synchronized", so it deadlocks, as first threads owns "synchronized".

h3.The problem can also be caused by User Management requests during startup
In one instance, we noticed a rest call from a downstream application (normal user requests are routed to the "Jira is Starting" page in modern versions of Jira. This was spotted very early in the application logs, before the instance had even started up.

{code}
2018-09-26 23:37:15,444 https-jsse-nio-443-exec-19 ERROR anonymous 1417x1x1 - 111.111.111.111 /rest/usermanagement/1/authentication [c.atlassian.instrumentation.Instrument] Unable to snapshot thread local operations (implementation of OpTimerFactory is not a ThreadLocalOpTimerFactory): null
{code}

This lead to a {{NullPointerException}} in that (and other HTTP threads). Eventually, the thread failed being unable to resolve the loginManager component with an {{java.lang.IllegalStateException: Unable to resolve component: interface com.atlassian.jira.security.login.LoginManager}} error.

{code}

	... 76 more
{code}

Blocking access to the instance from external consumers allowed the instance to restart successfully.

h3. Diagnosis Steps

We see the following line in {{DefaultInstrumentationListenerManager.endContext(Optional<Long>)}}:
{code:java}            Optional<InstrumentationListenerManager> manager = ComponentAccessor.getComponentSafely(InstrumentationListenerManager.class);
{code}
However, if one looks at {{DefaultInstrumentationListenerManager.startContext()}}, there is a guarding {{if()}} around retrieving this same component:
{code:java}//we do not want this to run if JIRA is not fully started as it may lead to deadlock in Pico
        if (ComponentManager.getInstance().getState().isStarted()) {
            ComponentAccessor.getComponentSafely(InstrumentationListenerManager.class) //... using the component
}
{code}
It looks like {{endContext()}} lacks the same precaution, which causes the deadlock.

h3.Workaround
The exact workaround will depend on your specific problem. This can be caused by a third party plugin, restoring getting HTTP access during the backup restore; or remote user management. 

# Try starting Jira with an empty {{installed-plugins}} folder - this helps to eliminate third party plugins
# If you're importing, close the browser after kicking off the restore process; this might help
# If you're not importing, and are seeing requests to Jira's User Management API, try using a reverse proxy or firewall to block access to Jira while it starts up (then re-enable it later.
fields.summary: JIRA deadlocks in PicoСontainer
JIRA health check include the integrity between tables and sequence_value_item

*Steps to reproduce:*
 # Go to General Configuration
 # Change Indexing Language to _German_
 # Change Default Language to _Deutsch (Deutschland)_
 # Change Default user time zone to _Europe_ and Timezone to _(GMT+01:00) Berlin_
 # Change any date picker field (e. g Due Date) to any date in March (e.g 4/Mrz/15 10:25 PM)

*Expected Result:*
 - JIRA should be able to recognize "Mrz" abbreviation for March

*Actual Result:*

*!march.png|thumbnail!*

*Possible Workaround:*
 - Change the date format from _20/Mrz/15_ to _20.03.15_ with the below setting in _Advanced Settings_:
{noformat}jira.date.picker.javascript.format=%d.%m.%y
jira.date.time.picker.javascript.format=%d.%m.%y %H:%M
jira.date.time.picker.java.format=d.MM.yy H:mm
jira.date.picker.java.format=d.MM.yy
{noformat}

 - Change date manually to 20/Mär/15 or 20/März/17
fields.summary: JIRA doesn't recognize "Mrz" abbreviation for March in German

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-62768].
  {panel}

Most of our projects consist of multiple components with different versions.

h5. Example
* Release 1
** Component A in version 6.4
** Component B in version 1.8.7
** Component C in version 8.1
* Release 2
** Component A in version 6.8
** Component B in version 2.5
** Component C in version 9.0

Our customers will get a bundle of these components labeled "Release 1". This cannot be modeled in JIRA. JIRA only supports versions and components.

This feature request shall provide a way such that components and their versions can be bundled in a "parent version".
fields.summary: Baselining versions and components

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Browser Information is not being collected at all the Issue Collector when the environment field is not on the default screen in the given project.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create an empty Jira instance
# Create a new project on that instance
# Create an issue collector inside the project making sure that the "Collect browser information" checkbox is checked
# Embed the issue collector on some website (e.g. http://jsbin.com/)
# Create issue using embedded collector
# Navigate to the issue

h3. Expected Results
The new issue should have the browser information stored in the environment field.

h3. Actual Results
The new issue doesn't have the environment field and it doesn't have the browser information.
 
h3. Notes
The reason it happens seems to be that the environment field is no longer on default screens for projects and therefore is discarded during issue creation.

h3.Workaround
To work around this issue, add the *Environment* system field to *any default* create screen in the project where you set up the issue collector. New issues created in this project using the issue collector will have the browser information collected in the environment field.

For example, for a scrum project named TEST, you can add it to the *TEST: Scrum Default Issue Screen* screen to get this to work.
fields.summary: Issue Collector: Collect Browser Info not working

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-62765].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
When configuring transition screens for a JIRA workflow, there is currently no way to provide a text snippet that describes the purpose, usage, etc. of the transition/screen.

h3. Suggested Solution
When creating/editing a Screen, either expose the "Description" field on the screen during a workflow transition or add a new field in the Screen create/edit process that will be exposed to users during a workflow transition.
 
h3. Workaround 
# Install the [JIRA Toolkit Plugin| https://marketplace.atlassian.com/plugins/com.atlassian.jira.toolkit/cloud/overview]
# Create a Custom Field of the type "Message Custom Field"
# Define the text you'd like to have on your screen transition in the custom field
# Add the custom field to your Screen
fields.summary: As an admin, I want to add a description to screens in my workflow

h3. Overview
The modal window becomes half the height when you select a project and when you select a project the project you selected isn't the project that it shows as selected.

h3. Steps to reproduce

# Click on Create button to create a new issue

Modal window should display correctly and indicate correct data being selected

h3. Actual Result
Modal window does not display correctly

h3. Work around
There is no work around other than using a desktop browser or iPhone / Android running the official Atlassian JIRA application

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-62756].
  {panel}

h3. Summary

When restoring a JIRA Cloud backup into JIRA Server a NumberFormatException error is thrown in the logs, failing to import AO tables.
h3. Steps to Reproduce

Restore a JIRA Cloud backup into JIRA Server
h3. Expected Results

Backup is restored successfully
h3. Actual Results

Backup created by JIRA Cloud is not escaping backslashes correctly, causing the import to expect an html code after the backslashes

The following error is thrown in the logs
{noformat}
2016-10-11 10:34:00,491 JiraImportTaskExecutionThread-1 INFO anonymous 633x26x1 kyp0t 127.0.0.1 /secure/SetupImport.jspa [c.a.j.bc.dataimport.DefaultDataImportService] Importing data is 90% complete...
2016-10-11 10:34:01,006 JiraImportTaskExecutionThread-1 INFO anonymous 633x26x1 kyp0t 127.0.0.1 /secure/SetupImport.jspa [c.a.j.bc.dataimport.DefaultDataImportService] Finished storing Generic Values.
2016-10-11 10:34:01,078 JiraImportTaskExecutionThread-1 DEBUG anonymous 633x26x1 kyp0t 127.0.0.1 /secure/SetupImport.jspa [c.a.activeobjects.osgi.ActiveObjectsServiceFactory] startCleaning
2016-10-11 10:34:01,085 JiraImportTaskExecutionThread-1 DEBUG anonymous 633x26x1 kyp0t 127.0.0.1 /secure/SetupImport.jspa [c.a.activeobjects.osgi.ActiveObjectsServiceFactory] stopCleaning
2016-10-11 10:34:04,064 JiraImportTaskExecutionThread-1 ERROR anonymous 633x26x1 kyp0t 127.0.0.1 /secure/SetupImport.jspa [c.a.j.bc.dataimport.DefaultDataImportService] Error importing data: java.lang.NumberFormatException: For input string: "olle"
java.lang.NumberFormatException: For input string: "olle"
 at java.lang.NumberFormatException.forInputString(NumberFormatException.java:65)
 at java.lang.Integer.parseInt(Integer.java:580)
 at com.atlassian.dbexporter.node.stax.StaxUtils.unicodeDecode(StaxUtils.java:103)
 at com.atlassian.dbexporter.node.stax.StaxStreamReader$1.getContentAsString(StaxStreamReader.java:125)
 at com.atlassian.dbexporter.importer.DataImporter$BaseInserter.setValue(DataImporter.java:354)
 at com.atlassian.dbexporter.importer.DataImporter.importTable(DataImporter.java:112)
 at com.atlassian.dbexporter.importer.DataImporter.access$000(DataImporter.java:41)
 at com.atlassian.dbexporter.importer.DataImporter$1.call(DataImporter.java:71)
 at com.atlassian.dbexporter.importer.DataImporter$1.call(DataImporter.java:64)
 at com.atlassian.dbexporter.jdbc.JdbcUtils.withConnection(JdbcUtils.java:28)
 at com.atlassian.dbexporter.importer.DataImporter.doImportNode(DataImporter.java:64)
 at com.atlassian.dbexporter.importer.AbstractImporter.importNode(AbstractImporter.java:44)
 at com.atlassian.dbexporter.DbImporter.importData(DbImporter.java:69)
 at com.atlassian.activeobjects.backup.ActiveObjectsBackup.restore(ActiveObjectsBackup.java:151)
 at com.atlassian.jira.bc.dataimport.DefaultDataImportService.restoreActiveObjects(DefaultDataImportService.java:554)
 at com.atlassian.jira.bc.dataimport.DefaultDataImportService.performImport(DefaultDataImportService.java:728)
 at com.atlassian.jira.bc.dataimport.DefaultDataImportService.doImport(DefaultDataImportService.java:324)
 at com.atlassian.jira.web.action.setup.DataImportAsyncCommand.call(DataImportAsyncCommand.java:60)
 at com.atlassian.jira.web.action.setup.DataImportAsyncCommand.call(DataImportAsyncCommand.java:28)
 at com.atlassian.jira.task.ImportTaskManagerImpl$TaskCallableDecorator.call(ImportTaskManagerImpl.java:157)
 at com.atlassian.jira.task.ImportTaskManagerImpl$TaskCallableDecorator.call(ImportTaskManagerImpl.java:133)
 at java.util.concurrent.FutureTask.run(FutureTask.java:266)
 at java.util.concurrent.Executors$RunnableAdapter.call(Executors.java:511)
 at java.util.concurrent.FutureTask.run(FutureTask.java:266)
 at java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor.runWorker(ThreadPoolExecutor.java:1142)
 at java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor$Worker.run(ThreadPoolExecutor.java:617)
 at java.lang.Thread.run(Thread.java:745)
2016-10-11 10:34:04,074 JiraImportTaskExecutionThread-1 WARN anonymous 633x26x1 kyp0t 127.0.0.1 /secure/SetupImport.jspa [c.a.j.p.d.dao.impl.CachingOrganizationDaoImpl] onImportCompleted - clearing cache !!
2016-10-11 10:34:04,079 JiraImportTaskExecutionThread-1 INFO anonymous 633x26x1 kyp0t 127.0.0.1 /secure/SetupImport.jspa [c.a.j.bc.dataimport.DefaultDataImportService] Importing data is 100% complete...


{noformat}
On this case, we had the following row causing problems in the activeobjects.xml file.
{code:xml}
<row>
 <integer>3444</integer>
 <integer>7409</integer>
 <string>excerpt</string>
 <string>'Collect status' column has been commented out on Views\Collectors\Index.cshtml</string>
 </row>


{code}
 
h3. Workaround

Add a second backslash to the activeobjects.xml file to escape the one already present like the following, zip the activeobjects.xml and exntities.xml file back and restore JIRA again. [We wrote a script to automate this details in this comment |#comment-975282]
{code:xml}
<row>
 <integer>3444</integer>
 <integer>7409</integer>
 <string>excerpt</string>
 <string>'Collect status' column has been commented out on Views\\Collectors\\Index.cshtml</string>
 </row>


{code}
You should be able to find the problematic row to edit using a regex similar to the following replacing the "olle" part with the one in the error thrown
{noformat}
\\.olle
{noformat}
fields.summary: Cloud backup fails to restore in JIRA Server with NumberFormatException
The Service Desk Migration Hub Should include the proper upgrade path

fields.description:
h3. Summary
User A who _do not_ have permission to *Browse Users* but have Administrator and/or System Administrator will have REST API result return empty. As an example of the json data return:
{code:borderStyle=dashed}
[]
{code}

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create User A
# Gives User A permission to Administrator and System Administrator
# Ensure User A do not have permission to Browse Users
# Login as User A
# Go to http://localhost:49748/jira721/rest/api/2/user/permission/search?permissions=PROJECT_ADMIN&projectKey=DEMO&username=

h3. Expected Results
Error suggesting User A do not have permission to Browse Users

h3. Actual Results
The response is:
{code:borderStyle=dashed}
[]
{code}
 
h3. Known affected REST API
* /rest/api/2/user/permission/search
* /rest/api/2/user/search
* /rest/api/2/user/viewissue/search


h3.Workaround
Add User A to Browse Users permission so that REST API return results
fields.summary: Empty REST API result return for User without Browse Users permission
